overview: 1 John combats early heresies denying Jesus came in the flesh. John provides tests of authentic faith—believing truth about Christ, obeying His commands, and loving fellow believers.

verses.text: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
Anyone who does not love does not know God, because God is love.
I write these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life.
We love because he first loved us.

passages.title: Walking in the Light
passages.summary: God is light. If we claim fellowship with Him while walking in darkness, we lie. But if we confess, He forgives.

passages.title: God Is Love
passages.summary: Love comes from God—He showed His love by sending His Son. Those who love are born of God and know God.

facts.text: 1 John never names its author, but early church tradition and vocabulary firmly link it to the apostle John.
John combats early Gnosticism, which denied Jesus' true humanity—hence his emphasis that Jesus came 'in the flesh.'
'Love' appears over 50 times in this short letter—it's John's central theme.
John wrote so believers could 'know' they have eternal life (5:13)—assurance is possible.

figures.name: John
figures.description: The 'apostle of love' and last surviving eyewitness, writing to preserve truth about Jesus and give assurance to believers.

videos.title: 1-3 John Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores John's tests of authentic Christian faith.
